intro: Anplectrum barbatum, commonly known as the beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats such as meadows and woodlands. Its flowers are often pink or purple and bloom in the summer months. Anplectrum barbatum is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance as a food source for pollinators.
